author: Tara Suter
description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon on Sunday pushed back on what she called a “misconception” of federal funding losses if her department is wound down at the federal level the way the Trump administration wants. “I think the misconception is that federal funding will go away if the Department of Education goes back more to the…
title: McMahon rejects ‘misconception’ of federal funding losses if Education Department heads back to states

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani was seriously injured in a car crash on Saturday evening in New Hampshire, according to a statement from his security team. Giuliani’s vehicle was “struck from behind at high speed,” Michael Ragusa, head of Giuliani’s security, said in an official news release. Giuliani, who previously served as President Trump’s…
title: Giuliani seriously injured in car crash

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore (D) said President Trump’s deployment of the National Guard in Washington, D.C., is “performative,” despite a recent drop in the violent crime rate. In an interview that aired Sunday on ABC News’s “This Week,” Moore acknowledged there’s more work to do in Baltimore to bring down the crime rate. He said…
title: Maryland Governor calls National Guard in DC ‘performative’

author: Sarah Polus
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem on Sunday teased the potential for further federal law enforcement intervention in Chicago and other Democratic-run cities nationwide following President Trump’s recent crime crackdown in Washington, D.C. Noem added that her department plans to “add more resources” to its operations in Chicago when asked about forthcoming plans for the Windy…
title: Noem teases federal crime crackdowns in other cities: ‘We haven’t taken anything off the table’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) said in a Sunday interview that Federal Reserve board member Lisa Cook should release her mortgage documents to dispel claims of fraud coming from the Trump administration, which is seeking her ouster. Pressed in an interview on NBC News’s “Meet the Press,” Khanna said Cook should release the documents to prove…
title: Khanna says Fed board member Lisa Cook should release mortgage documents amid Trump fight

author: Katy Boatman, opinion contributor
description: Despite the kindness of strangers, a couple in Houston faced a difficult and confusing process when trying to receive FEMA disaster assistance after their home flooded, highlighting the need for reform in the agency's bureaucracy.
title: President Trump must fix FEMA

author: William J. Congdon and Deborah Kobes, opinion contributors
description: Our country has the capacity to create a strong economy where workers don’t feel vulnerable.
title: 3 ways a comprehensive policy shift can protect workers

author: Rachel Scully
description: House Majority Whip Tom Emmer (R-Minn.) said that the Minneapolis shooting suspect “never should have had access or been able to possess a firearm” based on what we know about the shooter’s mental health issues. During an interview on ABC’s “This Week,” co-anchor Martha Raddatz asked Emmer about plans to prevent someone with mental health…
title: Emmer: Minneapolis shooter ‘never should have had access’ to a firearm

author: Norman Solomon, opinion contributor
description: Buttigieg now seems to personify how ambition can erode values.
title: Buttigieg has a flip-flop problem that could hurt in 2028

author: Julia Mueller
description: Arnold Schwarzenegger is stepping back into the political arena as a crusader against partisan redistricting.  Urging Californians to “terminate gerrymandering,” the former governor and Hollywood icon has joined the likes of former GOP Speaker Kevin McCarthy, investor Charlie Munger and state GOP legislators in pushing back on the plan, which could net five Democratic House…
title: Schwarzenegger steps back into political arena in redistricting crusade

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) said on Sunday that he is “very confident” in the passage of his and Rep. Thomas Massie’s (R-Ky.) bill on files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. “Congress left town early without voting on your bipartisan bill, which would basically call for the release of all of the…
title: Khanna says he is ‘very confident’ in passage of Epstein files bill

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. James Lankford (R-Okla.) said Sunday that he does not “connect” autism and vaccines in the wake of five top officials’ exit at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). “The science has debunked links between autism and vaccines for more than 20 years,” NBC News’s Kristen Welker said on “Meet the Press.” “Oh…
title: Lankford on autism and vaccines: ‘I don’t connect those two’

author: Tara Suter
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday “reaffirmed that the two countries were development partners” amid President Trump’s steep tariffs on India, according to a press release. According to a press release from Modi’s office, Xi and Modi had a meeting on Sunday in the Chinese city of Tianjin. The…
title: India, China reaffirm ‘development’ partnership amid steep Trump tariffs
